title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.55-58 | 26-01-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshurunmeelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Ganadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In the name of the Almighty, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful, and the Most Merciful,
this session will be discussing from the last portion of the seventh chapter of the first
canto of Bhagavatam, the verses, the remainder of the verses of this chapter, 55, 56, 57,
and 58. There are four more verses remaining and we will complete this in the session.
The fifty-fifth verse, Suta Vacha. Now, Suta Goswami is describing this whole incident.
Marrating this historical incident to the sage Suna Misharanya,
he is telling,
Arjuna ha sahasa agnyaya here hardam athasina manim jahar murdhanyam Drijasya sah murdhajam
Drijasya ah sah murdhanyam Drijasya such mood adjust sitting Arjuna hot To the entrance of Arizombur, it is'll give you –êthas participants that the adoration of thegers is where
the meaning of this verse, The meaning of this verse is that,
verses. Just then Arjuna could understand the motive of the Lord by his equivocal orders
and thus with a sword he severed both hair and jewel from the head of Ashwatthama. Equivocal
means ambiguous. Krishna said that you have got two contradictory things to be settled
and you have to act appropriately. So Arjuna could understand what is Krishna's motive
in giving him such an ambiguous order. You have to satisfy both Bhima and Draupadi. You
should keep your promise. You should act according to the rulings of the scriptures. So what
did Arjuna do? With his sword he cut off the hair.
And the jewel from the head of Ashwatthama. So in the purport Srila Prabhupada says contradictory
orders of different persons are impossible to carry out. Therefore a compromise was selected
by Arjuna by his sharp intelligence. This is where the intelligence is one takes help
of one's intelligence.
Of course here we have to understand taking help of intelligence means intelligence directed
by the super soul seated on the heart. Super soul is Krishna, Paramatma. And a devotee
like Arjuna is able to take help of his intelligence because he is Krishna conscious.
He is Krishna conscious therefore he is able to take help of his intelligence and understand
what is Krishna's direction in this regard. What should he do?
Now we should not think that we can also simply take help of our intelligence under all circumstances
and do whatever is according to our judgement using our intelligence, whatever the help
whatever is right we should do that that seems like a common sense thing to do but we should
also understand that if we are not 100% Krishna conscious we are unable to properly utilize our
intelligence the way Paramatma or Krishna directs it why because the Supreme Lord as Paramatma
directs the intelligence according to our desires according to our karma and according
to our position whether we are devotee or non-devotee for a devotee Krishna one was
10% Krishna conscious Krishna directly gives perfect instructions from within the heart
through the intelligence directly Krishna gives instructions for somebody's a non-devotee Krishna
is neutral he's neutral as Paramatma he actually considers any living being who is not Krishna
conscious ordinary people in this world most people
Krishna will as Paramatma consider what is the desire of the particular person then what is his
karma based on which what he deserves and accordingly Krishna will direct the intelligence
for the person to do in a particular act in a particular way now
Now supposing somebody actually desires to do something which is correct, then if his karma is to not do things right, because of his previous sinful activities,
then the direction will be given to do something wrong and not the right thing. So he will not get the correct direction through the intelligence, even though he wants to do something right.
You see, his desire is to do things right, but his karma is to do something wrong.
And therefore,
the intelligence will work in doing something wrong.
Now consider the other case.
Somebody doesn't actually know what is to be done, whether it is right or wrong.
But his karma is that he should do the right thing.
His karma is that he should be doing the right thing because he is a pious person.
He doesn't have sinful reaction of doing the wrong thing.
So then he is given the proper direction.
By the intelligence.
Because of his karma.
And his desire is to do the right thing.
And he is not sure what to do.
He is not sure what to do.
He is seeking direction.
So when we seek direction, we refer our intelligence.
So he is directed to do the right thing.
So Paramatma will always consider the desire.
The karma.
And it is according to the laws that are working.
Laws of nature.
There is no partiality.
There is no partiality in the part of the Supreme Lord.
It is less like a programmed machine.
It works regardless of who operates.
According to the program.
According to the way it is designed.
It will work.
So when we are not Krishna conscious.
We cannot always be sure.
Even if we want to do the right thing.
We can't always be sure we will be able to do the right thing.
Therefore the real way to ensure that we always do the right things.
And never do any sinful activity.
Never commit any mistake in our life.
Is to become completely Krishna conscious.
That is the only way.
Because we are very very very tiny.
As spirit soul.
Individual spirit soul.
We are very tiny.
We are subject to influence.
Of the illusory energy.
And.
Under the influence of the illusory energy.
If the mode of goodness is acting.
Then there is knowledge.
And proper direction.
Enlightened state.
There is proper direction.
To do the right things.
In the mode of passion.
We are confused.
In the mode of ignorance.
We do always the wrong things.
So these gunas are always.
Interacting.
And producing so many effects.
Sometimes sattva guna dominates.
Sometimes raja guna dominates.
Sometimes tamma guna dominates.
So it is very very difficult.
Under the influence of the gunas.
To always do the right thing.
There is no guarantee.
So therefore.
The shastras say.
If you want to do the right things.
You should actually.
Rise above the gunas.
How can you rise above the gunas.
How can you be situated without influence.
Without being affected by the influence of the gunas.
You should come to the spiritual platform.
Above the material platform of the three gunas.
And to come to that spiritual platform.
Is possible.
Only if you engage in pure devotional service.
This is told in the Bhagavad Gita.
mam chayo avyabhicharena bhakti-yogena sevate
sagunan samatityaitaan brahma bhuyaya kalpate
So here.
Arjuna.
He separated the jewel from the head of Ashwatthama.
And also.
Cut off his.
Hair.
Now this was as good as cutting off his head.
And yet his life was saved for all practical purposes.
See how Arjuna.
Actually was able to satisfy both.
Draupadi's request to save his life.
And Bhima Sena's.
Suggestion.
That.
Ashwatthama should be killed.
So certainly.
Ashwatthama is.
Twice born.
Because he is indicated here as.
Dvija.
Dvija.
Saha murdha jam.
Dvija.
He is twice born.
And he is twice born.
But he fell down from his position.
And.

He is.
He is.
He is.

He is.

And therefore.
He was properly punished.
So.
The 56th verse.
Vimuchya.
Rashana- meatballs.

Tejasaa-Maniina-heenam-sibiraan-nirayaa-payatt.
He had already lost his bodily luster due to infanticide.
And now moreover.
having lost the jewel from his head he would lost even more strength he was
unbound and driven out of the camp 57th verse
wapanam dravina adhanam sthanan niraya nirya panam tatha eshahi brahma bandhunam
badho nanyo asti dai hi kaha cutting the hair from his head depriving him of his
wealth and driving him from his residence are the prescribed punishments
for the relative of a Brahmana there is no injunction for killing the body so
Arjuna did not kill him but at the same time he cut his hair from his head
deprived him of his wealth his jewel was taken away and driving him from his
residence he was driven out of the of the camp so these are prescribed
punishments and Arjuna gave those proper punishments the last words are
58th verse of this chapter the closing words putra shoka tura sarve Pandava
sahakrishna swanam nutanam yatkrityam chakrur nirharana adhikam the meaning of
this verse the last verse thereafter the sons of Pandu and Draupadi overwhelmed
with grief performed the proper rituals for the dead bodies of
their relatives so they undertook the the duty of performing the rituals for
the departed souls that is the end of this chapter thank you very much Hare
Krishna
